definitions.definition: the process of making films, videos and computer games in which drawings, models or images of people and animals seem to move
a film in which drawings, models or images of people and animals seem to move

examples.text: The electronic dictionary included some animations.

definitions.definition: energy and enthusiasm in the way you look, behave or speak

examples.text: His face was drained of all colour and animation.
She talked about her new job with great animation.

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent. (in the sense ‘encouragement’): from Latin animatio(n-), from animare ‘instil with life’, from anima ‘life, soul’. Sense (1) dates from the early 19th cent.
